org.strongback.components

Interface ThreeAxisAccelerometer

  • All Superinterfaces:
    TwoAxisAccelerometer

    public interface ThreeAxisAccelerometer
extends TwoAxisAccelerometer
    An accelerometer is a device capable of sensing acceleration. By performing two integrations, an accelerometer can also find velocity and displacement.
    See Also:
    TwoAxisAccelerometer, Accelerometer

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static ThreeAxisAccelerometer create(Accelerometer xAxis, Accelerometer yAxis, Accelerometer zAxis)
      Create a 3-axis accelerometer from the three individual accelerometers.
      static ThreeAxisAccelerometer create(TwoAxisAccelerometer xAndY, Accelerometer zAxis)
      Create a 3-axis accelerometer from a 2-axis accelerometer and a separate accelerometer for the Z-axis.
      default ThreeAxisAcceleration getAcceleration()
      Get the instantaneous multidimensional acceleration values for all 3 axes.
      default Accelerometer getDirection(int axis)
      Get the accelerometer for the axis with the given index, where 0 is the X-axis, 1 is the Y-axis, and 2 is the Z-axis.
      Accelerometer getZDirection()
      Get the Z-axis accelerometer.

      • Methods inherited from interface org.strongback.components.TwoAxisAccelerometer

        create, getXDirection, getYDirection

    • Method Detail

      • getZDirection

        Accelerometer getZDirection()
        Get the Z-axis accelerometer.
        Returns:
        the accelerometer for the Z-axis; never null

      • getDirection

        default Accelerometer getDirection(int axis)
        Get the accelerometer for the axis with the given index, where 0 is the X-axis, 1 is the Y-axis, and 2 is the Z-axis.
        Specified by:
        getDirection in interface TwoAxisAccelerometer
        Parameters:
        axis - the axis direction; must be either 0 or 1
        Returns:
        the accelerometer; never null
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if axis is invalid

      • getAcceleration

        default ThreeAxisAcceleration getAcceleration()
        Get the instantaneous multidimensional acceleration values for all 3 axes.
        Specified by:
        getAcceleration in interface TwoAxisAccelerometer
        Returns:
        the acceleration values for 3 axes; never null

      • create

        static ThreeAxisAccelerometer create(Accelerometer xAxis,
                                     Accelerometer yAxis,
                                     Accelerometer zAxis)
        Create a 3-axis accelerometer from the three individual accelerometers.
        Parameters:
        xAxis - the accelerometer for the X-axis; may not be null
        yAxis - the accelerometer for the Y-axis; may not be null
        zAxis - the accelerometer for the Z-axis; may not be null
        Returns:
        the 3-axis accelerometer; never null

      • create

        static ThreeAxisAccelerometer create(TwoAxisAccelerometer xAndY,
                                     Accelerometer zAxis)
        Create a 3-axis accelerometer from a 2-axis accelerometer and a separate accelerometer for the Z-axis.
        Parameters:
        xAndY - the 2-axis accelerometer for the X- and Y-axes; may not be null
        zAxis - the accelerometer for the Z-axis; may not be null
        Returns:
        the 3-axis accelerometer; never null
